attributes.action: keep East Leake leisure centre open
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
East Leake Leisure Centre was built in 2003 under a PFI agreement with contractor McAlpine which agreed to run the facility at £352,000 a year. 

Carillion took over management in February 2008 and has asked for an extra £285,000 a year to run it. 

The council are unhappy about giving Carilion the extra money and are now considering allowing them to "mothball" our leisure centre, at a cost to us (the council tax payers!) of £352,000 per annum for the next 19 years.

The leisure centre is the backbone of our community and plays a key role in keeping the 7,000 residents of East Leake fit and healthy. Many local schools use the facilities with their pupils every day, along with local organisations. 

The closure of the leisure centre would be a huge loss to all the community, especially the children who enjoy the many fantastic activities there so much.

government_responses.details:
